CatDescriptText: John McWayne, unemployed, Crestas Terrace, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "Yes, they should. And this should be no only for the colored people, but for anybody, no matter who they are.  There should be no discrimination, regardless of whether the persons are white or colored.  This principle is the foundation of our country."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John McWayne wearing overcoat, light colored v neck sweater, dark striped necktie, and light colored hat with band, standing in front of Bud Saunder's flower store in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
